segments.text: I can't believe what I'm seeing; the boy is climbing on that stool, reaching for the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It looks so unstable, like it could tip over at any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's stretching his arm, trying to grab as many cookies as he can.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a knot in my stomach, anticipating a fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl next to him seems excited, waiting for her share of the cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn't seem to notice the danger either, just like the woman at the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder why no one is paying attention to what's happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's frustrating to see such carelessness, especially with children involved.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to shout and warn them, but I know they can't hear me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope everything turns out okay, but I can't shake off this feeling of dread.
segments.speaker: PAR
